questions.question: Supply refers to:
options: Willingness to sell at different prices
questions.explanation: Supply is the quantity of a good that producers are willing and able to offer for sale at various prices during a given period.

questions.question: Law of supply states that:
options: Higher price leads to higher supply
Higher price leads to lower supply
Price has no effect on supply
questions.explanation: The law of supply states that, all else equal, as the price of a good rises, the quantity supplied also rises.

questions.question: In a free market economy, price is determined by:
questions.explanation: In a free market, prices are determined by the interaction of demand and supply forces without government intervention.

questions.question: Market equilibrium occurs when:
questions.explanation: Market equilibrium is where the quantity demanded equals the quantity supplied, so there is no pressure for price to change.

questions.question: Net addition to total utility when one more unit is consumed is:
questions.explanation: Marginal Utility (MU) is the additional utility gained from consuming one more unit of a good.

questions.question: Most important determinant of demand is:
questions.explanation: Price is the most immediate and significant factor affecting quantity demanded, as per the law of demand.

questions.question: Which of the following is the reason for law of demand:
questions.explanation: The income effect explains that as price falls, real income rises, leading to higher quantity demanded.

questions.question: When there are only few sellers of the commodity, the market is called:
questions.explanation: Oligopoly is a market structure characterized by a small number of sellers.

questions.question: If the supply curve of the commodity is having a positive slope, a rise in the price of the commodity, results in:
questions.explanation: A movement along the supply curve due to price change is called a change in quantity supplied (not a shift in supply).

questions.question: From the position of stable equilibrium, the market supply of a commodity decreases, while the market demand remains unchanged, then:
options: Both equilibrium price and equilibrium quantity decreases
Equilibrium price rises, but equilibrium quantity falls
questions.explanation: Decrease in supply with unchanged demand leads to higher price and lower quantity at the new equilibrium.

questions.question: Elasticity of supply for a positively sloped straight line supply curve that intersects the price axis is:
questions.explanation: If a straight-line supply curve intersects the price axis, its elasticity is > 1 (elastic) at all points.

questions.question: In which of the following market, advertisement is absent:
questions.explanation: In perfect competition, products are homogeneous, so advertising is unnecessary and absent.

questions.question: --- cost can never become zero.
questions.explanation: Fixed costs remain constant regardless of output and cannot be zero as long as the firm operates.

questions.question: If a positively sloped linear supply curve crosses the quantity axis, the elasticity of supply is:
questions.explanation: A straight-line supply curve intersecting the quantity axis has elasticity < 1 (inelastic) at all points.
